This Agreement to be for a Commercial Landing Base for aircraft of British Overseas Airways Corporation. (a) The area as previously defined by Imperial Airways Limited to be properly buoyed and marked by the British Overseas Airways Corporation. (b) The rent to be charged is to include the pay of guards^ the use of the alighting area and the space required for the permanent jetty, sheds for the motor launches, passenger shelter and store. It will be Rs,940/- a month. This sum is exclusive of landing charges. 2. (a) The buildings and other constructions mentioned in Clause 1(b) above will be carried out by the Corporation. All such buildings and constructions, if of an immovable nature, will become the Shaikh's property on termination of the lease. 1 (b) Buildings and constructions must be on land or v/ater owned by the Shaikh. (c) -All materials such as stones and lime required for building and construction work to be obtained from the Dubai mines. 3. Should this sea landing base reciuire dredging or other work carried out in connection with it, then the cost of such work is to be borne by the Corporation and the Shaikh will in no way be held liable for the payment of any compensation to the Corporation. 4. Labourers required for work on the landing base should be natives of Dubai. 5. Should any employee cf the Corporation commit any crime, the Shaikh should lodge a complaint against him with the Political Resident who v/ill investigate the case and take what action may be desirable. 6. Should any Dubai subject be accused of any offence in respect of the Commercial Landing Base at Dubai he shall not be punished until the offence has been proved to the joint satisfaction of the Shaikh of Dubai and the Political Agent. 7. No employee (foreign) of the Corporation shall enter the town at night. Should any person infringe this rule by entering the town at night and, God forbid, suffer injury or loss, then the Shaikh will not be held responsible. 8. Guards and watchmen ox' the landing base will be appointed by the Shaikh. 9. (a) No women or sailors should be permitted to seek refuge in the landing base. Co)/(b) The Shaikh's internal affairs shall not be interfered v/ith in any manner whatsoever, 10. A charge of Rs.5/- will be paid to the Shaikh lor every landing by an aircraft. 11. If any injury is done to the craft or its people by any outside enemy then the Government, when necessity arises, should assist the Shaikh by all means. 12. Natives of Dubai should be employed by the Corporation in the landing base for all such work as they are capable of doing. 13. Should liquor be necessary for the special use of the landing base the Corporation shall on no account permit the sale of such liquor to the natives of and person residing in the Country and Town of Dubai. 14. This Agreement will be for a period of five years with effect from the 22nd July 1938. Sd. Shaikh Sa'id bin Maktum Ruler of Dubai (6th June 1938 = ) Sd. H. Weightman, Political Agent, Bahrain.

mods.abstract: This printed memorandum is a copy of a commercial air agreement signed by Shaikh Sa'id bin Maktum [Sa‘īd bin Maktūm Āl Maktūm], the ruler of Dubai, and Hugh Weightman, Political Agent at Bahrain, on 6 June 1938. The agreement contains fourteen numbered clauses, some with lettered sub-clauses. The agreement is for a commercial landing base for aircraft of British Overseas Airways Corporation (BOAC), and regulates construction, maintenance, labour, landing fees, and issues such as liquor.
